body_html:
I agree with @Linusnie that contrib.slim.conv2d should check its input rank. However since it is under contrib module, I'm afraid that the issue might not be resolved quickly. So I prefer to use tf.layers.conv2d.

About the second point, as @sguada said:

Allowing other dimensions to run the conv2d on, that would be difficult since cuDNN doesn't support it.

I think the feature will be useful, however it seems difficult to implement currently. And to get around the problem, we can reshape our data before and after calculation like you do. cc @fchollet who might be interested.

About the second point, as @sguada said:

I think the feature will be useful, however it seems difficult to implement currently. And to get around the problem, we can reshape our data before and after calculation like you do.  cc @fchollet who might be interested.
body:
I agree with @Linusnie that `contrib.slim.conv2d` should check its input rank. However since it is under contrib module, I'm afraid that the issue might not be resolved quickly. So I prefer to use ` tf.layers.conv2d`.

About the second point, as @sguada said:
> Allowing other dimensions to run the conv2d on, that would be difficult since cuDNN doesn't support it.

I think the feature will be useful, however it seems difficult to implement currently. And to get around the problem, we can reshape our data before and after calculation like you do.  cc @fchollet who might be interested.
